decision_conditions: Two of the Oaks and the hornbeam group (T12, T15 and G13 on application) are situated to the rear of the property and have Moderate amenity values. The final Oak (T4 on application) is situated to the front of the property and as a result has a Moderate to high amenity value. All five trees significantly contribute to the arboricultural amenity of the CopseWood Estate Area of Special Local Character (ASLC). They provide a gradual transition of mature tree cover between the dwellings in the copse wood estate and the nearby Ruislip woods National Nature Reserve (NNR). The benefit in amenity and biodiversity afforded by the trees is both present and future because they have the potential for long life expectancies.

The applicant is using an Arboricultural report dated 13th February 2018 as evidence that the work is required, however within this report the Consultant recommends no action required for all five trees. As a result there are no valid arboricultural reasons provided.  Pruning w
The removal of deadwood, dangerous / hanging branches and ivy:  This does not require the formal consent of the Council.
description: To carry out tree surgery including a crown reduction by 1m to three Oaks (T4, T12 and T15 on application) and two Hornbeams (G13 on application) all within Area 1 on TPO 400.
